intro: Dactyloctenium ciliare, commonly known as the silky grass or slender grass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, leafy stems and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces fluffy, wind-dispersed seeds that aid in its propagation across various habitats. Its leaves are typically narrow and slightly hairy, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Dactyloctenium ciliare is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
